properties.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentMethod
properties.Description:
Assessment methods or approaches for setting or adjusting premium for substandard risk cases.

Ex:
- Extra Percentage Table
- Lien System
- Permanent Flat Extra Premium
- Temporary Flat Extra Premium
- Rate-Up

where:

EXTRA PERCENTAGE TABLE
A mortality or morbidity table that shows the extra premium for specific impaired health conditions.
This premium is usually shown as a percentage of the standard premium.

LIEN SYSTEM
A plan for the issuance of life insurance coverage on substandard risks in which a standard premium is paid but less than the full face amount of the insurance policy is payable if death occurs within a certain period of years.

PERMANENT FLAT EXTRA PREMIUM
A permanent fixed premium increase to accommodate a permanent condition such as a hazardous occupation, residential location or physical condition.

The flat extra premiums do not increase the cash or nonforfeiture values of the policy.

Extra premiums may be removed when the insured's condition has changed or the risk is reduced.

TEMPORARY FLAT EXTRA PREMIUM
A temporary fixed premium increase to accommodate a temporary condition such as a temporary hazardous occupation.

RATE-UP
Life insurance coverage that is issued at a higher rate than is standard because of the physical impairment of the insured.

Under this method the insured is assumed to be some years older than they really are and the policy is issued with the corresponding higher premium.

Columns.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Substandard Risk Assessment Method.

Columns.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentMethodName
Columns.Description: The name of a Substandard Risk Assessment Method.

Columns.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentMethodDescription
Columns.Description: The description of a Substandard Risk Assessment Method.
